games.name: .hack//Infection
games.textblurb:
First of a quartet of games, this is a 'game within a game' deal, where the protagonist plays an MMORPG that is beginning to affect players in the real world. The anime released alongside this is one of the first examples of Isekai that I can think of. That should tell you everything you need to know!

Note: If this game happens, it will not be a full playthrough. Very menu heavy in a not-fun way, but I'd like to show it off for a bit as a novelty game (for the time, and for me)

games.name: Valkyrie Profile 2: Silmeria
games.textblurb:
Continuing the low level playthrough, possibly into Seraphic Gate or higher NG+s to see what's up. If NG+ happens, watch cutscenes once and skip on NG+s.

One of my favourite battle systems in any JRPG ever (VP1 but better), and I would love to know it even better. Gameplay heavy stream.

games.name: Super Mario Odyssey
games.textblurb: The odd game out. I've been lowkey itching to play a 3D platformer and I still only barely touched this one. This one is apparently real gosh darn good, so I'd like to give it a go sometime.

games.name: Final Fantasy XIII-3 Lightning Returns
games.textblurb:
If Taylor isn't gonna play it again, I will. Great gameplay & soundtrack, you can tell that Tri-Ace helped with this.

More action-y than its predecessors. Paradigm system is still there, but now you only play as one character and change outfits instead, each with its own ATB bar. ATB is now a resource that charges like you'd expect it to, and is used like MP. Frequent switching to resource manage/recover or to set up combos. Just a joy to play.

games.name: Breath of Fire 3
games.textblurb:
I don't remember much about this game, other than Rei being an absolute bro and the fishing minigame owning. I want to revisit it because a) it's been a while and I remember enjoying it and b) it's a Capcom RPG. Don't get a whole lot of those.

Possibly Breath of Fire 4 some time after this.

games.name: Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles (Remastered)
games.textblurb:
It didn't work out on release, but I'd like to give this another shot, maybe as an 'end of stream' game. Great soundtrack, copy-pasted art from FF9, cute moogles, cute world map, cute everything tbh.

Original Morning Sky is better, but what can ya do.

games.name: Star Ocean Second Evolution
games.textblurb:
My first Star Ocean game, and apparently one of the best ones! Spoiler alert: This is another Tri-Ace franchise and that means it has certain qualities to it: Namely, an enjoyable combat system with a nice soundtrack to accompany it.

Story-wise, it's a regular JRPG story set in space, but you can decide who the protagonist is. With the 'maybe game' vote you can specify either Claude or Rena as protag. If empty, my choice.
